intro: Pourthiaea fokienensis, commonly known as the Fokien helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, rhizomatous roots and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences, often with a subtle fragrance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
